name: Master of None Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Dev, the main character, was an actor in a commercial for what product?
questions.explanation:
GoGurt.

	Dev is a 30-year-old professional actor who, at the time of the pilot, had only ever booked one job. Dev was living off the dividends of the GoGurt commercial while figuring out what he wanted to do with his life.

questions.text: While at the store with his one night stand, what drink did Dev buy?
questions.explanation:
Martinelli's Apple Juice.

	Dev went on and on about how great the apple juice was. They were at the store to purchase contraceptives, and Dev didn't quite remember his "dates" name. He made an effort to buy her the apple juice and bragged about it to his friends the next day.

Aziz Ansari.

	Ansari created the show, served as one of the writers, producers, and several other jobs. He is also a stand up comedian and author. Ansari starred as Dev and his real-life parents played the character's parents in the series.

questions.text: In a dream sequence, how many kids did Dev have?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Dev, who was babysitting a friend's children, had a dream of what it would be like if he had his own children. In the dream he had two kids, one boy and one girl.  After snapping out of the dream he realized he wasn't ready for parenthood.

questions.text: What product was Dev forced to buy after the child he was babysitting "damaged" them in the store?
questions.explanation:
waffles.

	Grant, the boy he was babysitting, got away from him while they were shopping. When store employees brought Grant back to Dev, they were carrying a package of waffles and told him that the child had touched his penis to them. Dev agreed to buy the waffles, and then was told he had to buy all 30 packages the boy and damaged in the same fashion.

questions.text: What year did Dev's dad move to New York City?
questions.explanation:
1980.

	Dev was a first generation American after his family emigrated from India. After his parents emigrated, Dev was born a few years later and lived his entire life (at least through the first season of the show) in New York City. During the course of the season Dev learns more and more about the struggles his parents went through as immigrants in the 1980s.

questions.text: Dev and his friend were thinking of seeing a movie and used that as an excuse to get out of having dinner with their parents. What was the friend's name?
questions.explanation:
Brian.

	Brian was also a first generation American, born to immigrant parents. Brian's parents were from from Korea. The movie they chose to go see was the "current" "X-Men" movie. Dev called it the ninth best of the 15 movies in the franchise.

questions.text: Dev's parents fell madly in love and married after moving to New York.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The couple, Ramesh and Nisha, were married in India through an arranged marriage before they moved to the U.S. Dev learned that during a dinner with Brian and his father, and both of Dev's parents as they all sat down and chatted for the first time.

questions.text: What type of restaurant did Dev and Brian's families decide to eat at in the episode "Parents"?
questions.explanation:
Chinese.

	The families were immigrants from India and Korea, and chose to eat Chinese when they went out. There were several choices where they couldn't decided what to eat and finally all agreed to eat at the local Chinese place. Dev's mom, Nisha, later told her husband that she disliked Chinese food.

questions.text: What game was Dev playing when he flashed back to his childhood?
questions.explanation:
Streetfighter.

	During the flashback Dev was remembering a moment in 1992 when he was 7. He was playing "Street Fighter" while listening to his dad talk about what childhood was like back in India.
